intro: Tephrosia smythiae, commonly known as the golden tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, adding visual appeal to its natural habitat. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia smythiae is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
